result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Temple was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month to commence 8/15/2016 or serve community service at the rate of $10.00 per hour; alternate 21 days jail.
DNA to be paid along with fine on payment plan.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Temple

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew R Temple in court with attorney Kelsey Morin and Legal Intern Megan Goke.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea to the charge. Court imposed the following sentence:

Court orders that the firearm be returned to the defendant. 
Fine $883.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to pay $25/a month or do community service at the rate of $10.00 a hour or the alternate is 21 days jail
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
dated 6/10/16 filed by Attorney Hulgaard
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Matthew R Temple did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on June 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on June 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Matthew R Temple in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is requesting adjournment due to a witness not being available. Defense has no objections and is requesting that Ms. Hulgaard appear at the next hearing so attorney Morin can speak with her regarding a alternative resolution. Court does order that Ms. Hulgaard must appear at the next hearing. Court adjourns for a status hearing and Ms. Temple is excused from appearing at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Letter dated 5/16/16 requesting adjournment filed by State
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing on June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Request for adjournment filed by State

Approved by Judge Maxwell 4/7/16
Jury status hearing on May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Trial scheduling order signed by Judge Maxwell 3/23/16.

Defendant Matthew R Temple in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin requets the Court set the matter for trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing at 03-23-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Matthew R Temple in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for her client to complete the treatment. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Matthew R Temple in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting adjournment to go over Discovery. Court grants the request.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing at 12-22-2015 10:00 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report today.

Defendant Matthew R Temple in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  WCS can be reviewed by the Judge at the next hearing. 
  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
